entities: African Union Peace and Security Council
summary:
The Security Council:

* Welcomes efforts of African Union and subregional organizations to strengthen peacekeeping capacity and coordinate with UN (para 4)
* Welcomes cooperation between UN, African Union, and European Union, and encourages regional organizations to strengthen cooperation (paras 5-6)
* Determines to strengthen cooperation with regional organizations, particularly African Union Peace and Security Council (para 7)
* Aims to enhance cooperation in conflict prevention, resolution, and management, including mediation and sanctions (para 8)
* Stresses that cooperation should be based on complementary capacities (para 9)
* Underlines importance of implementing Ten-Year Capacity-Building Programme for African Union (para 10)
* Encourages increased engagement of African Union Peacekeeping Support Team with UN Department of Peacekeeping Operations (para 11)
* Calls on Secretariat to develop list of needed capacities and recommendations for African Union (para 12)
* Encourages closer cooperation between UN Secretariat and African Union Commission (para 13)
* Determines to consider strengthening UN capacity in conflict prevention (para 14)
* Recognizes role of Secretary-General's good offices in Africa and encourages mediation (para 15)
* Welcomes proposal for African Union-UN panel to consider financing modalities for regional peacekeeping operations (para 16)
* Requests Secretary-General to include assessments of progress on cooperation in regular reporting to Security Council (para 17)
* Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 18)
